page.title: 10TRANSPORT IN CODICOTE/WELWYN
page.content: Easy access to the railway and the A1 Motorway has made this area a convenient and popular place for commuters to live and have a comparatively quick journey to London or neighbouring towns. The A1M northwards from Welwyn was opened in July 1962 and ten years later the southern stretch was completed. The good bus services of the past have now been severely cut due to the growth of car ownership, many house- holds having at least two cars. There is a six day half-hourly bus service from Hitchin to Potters Bar via Welwyn and a bi-hourly seven day Green Line between Hitchin and Reading via the B197. Codicote is served by one bus from Welwyn Garden City to Hitchin, Mon to Sat, and one from Stevenage to Luton 3 days a week.
